feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 06 at 3:36PM AKST until February 08 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 9 AM AKST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 50 below zero. * WHERE...Kuskokwim Delta. * WHEN...From 9 PM this evening to 9 AM AKST Tuesday.

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued February 06 at 2:56PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: An atmospheric river will move over the Gulf of Alaska and into the panhandle for the late Tuesday to Thursday time period. This will bring a period of moderate to heavy rain as the moisture band moves over panhandle. A couple of waves will move along the main moisture band and produce impulses of heavier precipitation. Precise timing and location of the heaviest precipitation over

entry.title: Wind Chill Warning issued February 06 at 1:32PM AKST until February 07 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously cold wind chills expected. The dangerously cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. Expect wind chills to range from 50 below zero to 65 below zero. * WHERE...Southeastern Brooks Range Passes.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 06 at 1:32PM AKST until February 09 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow occurring. Plan on difficult travel conditions. Additional snow accumulations around one inch are expected. * WHERE...Dalton Highway Summits. * WHEN...Until noon Wednesday.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 06 at 1:32PM AKST until February 09 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow occurring. Plan on slippery road conditions. In addition, areas of poor visibility are expected. Additional snow accumulations around one 1 inch are expected. * WHERE...Elliott Highway Summits. * WHEN...Until noon Wednesday.

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued February 06 at 2:19PM SST by NWS
entry.summary: ...The hydrologic outlook has been replaced by a flash flood watch... As conditions for flash flooding increases with incoming showers to the south and west associated with a monsoonal trough, a flash flood watch goes into effect beginning Monday morning.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 06 at 6:08PM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...SNOW SHOWERS AND SLICK ROADS WILL RESULT IN HAZARDOUS TRAVEL CONDITIONS THIS EVENING... Snow showers and snow covered roads will cause locally hazardous travel conditions this evening. Motorists should use caution. The snow showers are expected to taper off by mid-evening, with only minor accumulations expected.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 06 at 6:08PM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...SNOW AND FREEZING DRIZZLE WILL RESULT IN HAZARDOUS TRAVEL CONDITIONS THIS EVENING... Light to occasionally moderate snow showers will result in additional accumulations of around an inch this evening. The snow is expected to mix with freezing drizzle for a while during the mid to late evening.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Door; Northern Marinette County; Southern Marinette County

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 06 at 6:08PM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FREEZING DRIZZLE AND LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS MAY RESULT IN HAZARDOUS TRAVEL CONDITIONS THIS EVENING... Freezing drizzle, scattered light snow showers and falling temperatures will result in slippery roads this evening. Additional ice and snow accumulations are expected to be light. Untreated roads will be snow or ice covered in spots this evening,
